en.alias: Acting with purpose 3: The anxiety loop-4

sections.content:
In this short course you've **reconnected** to what matters to you in order to live a **meaningful life.**

As practice over time is crucial, we highly recommend that you **continue** **using** your tools over and over again. So, the next step on your path is to **reflect** on your **learnings** and how they can help you going forward.
sections.title: Keep practicing

sections.question: What tools are you committed to continue practicing?
sections.exampleText: All of them: reconnecting to my values, creating a compass, meditation, snapping out of the anxiety loop by changing my actions or helping someone else out.

sections.longDescription:
Write down your answers.

1. What **tools** help you **connect** to and **act** according with your **values**?
2. What, if anything, has **changed** for you since you've started this course?
sections.title: Exercise

sections.content:
3. Why is it important to you to keep **developing** your toolkit for **acting** on your values?
4. What are the most **important** **learnings** you want to carry with you?

Well done on completing the course **Acting with purpose**.

To continue your practice, we recommend **incorporating** the **tools** you've found helpful into your life. You may also like to check out our **other** **courses**, for examples on Dealing with stress and Self-compassion.

For the **research** behind this course, you’ll find references on our [website](https://29k.org/).

Love,

The 29k-team
sections.title: Summary
Sharing
sections.content:
You are now ready for the next step — to share with your group.

Remember the questions:

1. What **alternative** **behaviors** helps you break your anxiety loop?
2. What **tools** help you **connect** to and **act** according with your **values**?
3. What, if anything, has **changed** for you since you've started this course?
4. Why is it important to you to keep **developing** your toolkit for **acting** on your values?
5. What are the most **important** **learnings** you want to carry with you?
